column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Laassel (Morocco) (spoke in French): Allow\r
#Text=me at the outset to convey to you, Sir, on behalf of the\r
#Text=Moroccan delegation, our gratitude for the convening\r
#Text=of this debate.
#Text=I thank for their briefings Secretary-\r
#Text=General Ban Ki-moon; Ms.
#Text=Navanethem Pillay, High\r
#Text=Commissioner for Human Rights; and Ms.
#Text=Phumzile\r
#Text=Mlambo-Ngcuka, Executive Director of UN Women.
#Text=I welcome Ms.
#Text=Mlambo-Ngcuka's appointment and\r
#Text=assure her of our full cooperation and support as she\r
#Text=discharges her mission.
#Text=We also thank Ms.
#Text=Brigitte\r
#Text=Balipou, Chair of the NGO Working Group on Women,\r
#Text=Peace and Security, for her constructive contribution.
#Text=My delegation welcomes the report of the Secretary-\r
#Text=General on women, peace and security (S/2013/525)\r
#Text=and the adoption of resolution 2122 (2013) on the issue.
#Text=The report takes stock of the actions and initiatives of\r
#Text=Member States in the framework of implementation\r
#Text=of the resolution, especially in strengthening women's\r
#Text=participation in decision-making, integrating gender-\r
#Text=specific issues in peacekeeping operations and\r
#Text=training staff who participate in those operations.
#Text=The report confirms that much work remains, despite\r
#Text=the significant progress of women's participation in\r
#Text=peacekeeping operations and their representation in the\r
#Text=decision-making process.
#Text=The signing of peace agreements and ceasefire\r
#Text=agreements and the implementation of national action\r
#Text=plans and programmes for the protection of women in\r
#Text=conflict-affected countries have made it possible to\r
#Text=identify, in a more appropriate way, the ways and means\r
#Text=likely to promote women's rights and to strengthen their\r
#Text=participation in efforts to prevent and resolve conflicts\r
#Text=and in post-conflict reconstruction.
#Text=My delegation supports the initiatives of the Team\r
#Text=of Experts on the Rule of Law and Sexual Violence in\r
#Text=Conflict to assist States in strengthening the rule of\r
#Text=law, transitional justice and security sector reform.
#Text=My\r
#Text=delegation also supports the elaboration by the Standing\r
#Text=Committee on Women, Peace and Security of the\r
#Text=strategic framework intended to assist Member States\r
#Text=in achieving their interim objectives, in preparation for\r
#Text=the meeting planned for 2015 on the implementation\r
#Text=of resolution 1325 (2000) at national, regional and\r
#Text=international levels.
#Text=Effective and optimal empowerment of women\r
#Text=in the context of peacebuilding and post-conflict\r
#Text=reconstruction involves the collective and coordinated\r
#Text=action of the international community and the United\r
#Text=Nations system, through strengthening protection and\r
#Text=prevention measures adapted to specific contexts that\r
#Text=will facilitate the implementation of the resolution.
#Text=The establishment of genuine peace requires\r
#Text=the establishment of inclusive and durable political,\r
#Text=economic and social structures.
#Text=Within that\r
#Text=framework, local women's entities are a driving\r
#Text=force in empowering women and strengthening good\r
#Text=governance.
#Text=My delegation welcomes the work carried\r
#Text=out in the framework of the United Nations system\r
#Text=to strengthen women's capacities and involvement in\r
#Text=mediation and peacebuilding processes.
#Text=Similarly, it\r
#Text=supports the implementation of the Secretary-General's\r
#Text=seven-point action plan (see S/2010/466), which enables\r
#Text=greater consideration of gender issues in peacebuilding\r
#Text=operations.
#Text=As for protection, my delegation notes with concern\r
#Text=that refugee or displaced women continue to suffer most\r
#Text=from generalized insecurity, difficult living conditions\r
#Text=and limited access to humanitarian assistance.
#Text=The\r
#Text=same is true for refugee women who lack documents\r
#Text=and often face gender-based discrimination, especially\r
#Text=in accessing basic social services.
#Text=In that connection,\r
#Text=it is essential that Member States - especially the\r
#Text=States parties to the 1951 Convention relating to the\r
#Text=Status of Refugees - comply with their obligations\r
#Text=and register refugees in their territory.
#Text=Registration and\r
#Text=identification programmes can have a positive impact\r
#Text=in empowering women refugees.
#Text=My delegation welcomes the efforts undertaken\r
#Text=by the Department of Peacekeeping Operations\r
#Text=(DPKO) in the protection of women in armed conflict\r
#Text=and the consideration of gender-specific issues in the\r
#Text=framework of the maintenance of peace.
#Text=We stress that\r
#Text=it is important that DPKO strengthen its work on the\r
#Text=ground, in coordination with the relevant parties.
#Text=While the responsibility to put an end to the tragic\r
#Text=consequences of armed conflict for women and children\r
#Text=lies with States, coordinated and sustained action\r
#Text=among the various national and United Nations actors\r
#Text=involved in the implementation of resolution 1325\r
#Text=(2000) is necessary to strengthen existing initiatives.
#Text=Firm political will and full commitment of Member\r
#Text=States to the measures in resolution 1325 (2000)\r
#Text=will guarantee the active participation of women in\r
#Text=national, regional and international institutions for\r
#Text=the prevention, protection and management of conflict\r
#Text=situations.
